title: Our fight against plastic pollution in California | TNC
body: June 30, 2022 — Today, CA took decisive action to fight plastic pollution, signing into law SB 54—the nation's most comprehensive and ambitious policy to address pollution from single-use plastic packaging and foodware. Read the full statement. The Problem Our plastic problem is bigger than you think.
readable_content:
- The text is an article from The Nature Conservancy website, discussing California's efforts to address plastic pollution. The article gives an overview of the plastic pollution problem in California and emphasizes that the plastic industry should take responsibility for its products rather than burdening consumers with the cleanup.

- The Nature Conservancy is working on policy advancements and partnerships with global clothing brands to address the issue. The article also touches on the impact of plastic pollution on the environment and health, and potential solutions to the problem.

- The goal is to reduce plastic waste and strengthen California's position as a global leader in plastic waste reduction. The article encourages readers to take action to tackle plastic pollution.

- The article is last updated on August 08, 2022.

- The Nature Conservancy is a nonprofit organization, and the article includes links to donate and get involved.

Overall, the article highlights the severity of the plastic pollution issue and the ongoing efforts to combat it in California.
summary:
The conversation about addressing plastic pollution in California, as highlighted in the article from The Nature Conservancy, emphasizes the severity of the issue and the ongoing efforts to combat it. The sentiment is focused on the importance of taking action to reduce plastic waste and holding the plastic industry accountable.
